job.title: Business Intelligence Business Objects SQL Developer (32539)
job.description:
Location: Remote (with occasional travel to Springfield, Illinois)

Contract: 12 months with possibly multiyear extension/s

Functional Description: 

Clover Consulting (a Myticas Co.) is seeking a skilled and experienced BI BusinessObjects/SQL Developer to design, develop, and maintain business intelligence solutions using SAP BusinessObjects and SQL. This role supports Medicaid/CHIP claims and other healthcare data systems, ensuring accurate reporting and data integrity for state and federal stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and maintain BusinessObjects reports using Medicaid/CHIP claims and subsystem data.
  • Write, optimize, and maintain complex SQL scripts and queries for data marts and reporting.
  • Create and manage BusinessObjects Universes and metadata layers.
  • Develop and maintain database systems to support efficient data storage and reporting.
  • Manage server backups and ensure system reliability.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and recommend technical solutions.
  • Participate in unit, integration, and system testing.
  • Provide regular project updates to customers and maintain strong communication.
  • Mentor junior team members and provide technical training as needed.
  • Stay current with emerging technologies and industry best practices.
  • Perform additional duties as required to support project and organizational goals.

Required Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of experience in SAP BusinessObjects development and reporting including report Universe designing.
  • 5+ years of SQL development, including 4+ years of performance tuning.
  • 2+ years of experience in data warehouse projects.
  • 2+ years of experience with Teradata (v15+), including SQL Assistant.
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to work directly with clients.
  • Bachelor’s or advanced degree in IT, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
  • Excellent organizational skills and ability to manage multiple priorities.
  • Strong team collaboration and adaptability.

Preferred Qualifications: 

  • 2+ years of experience as Business Objects server administrator
  • Familiarity with Medicaid, Medicare, or healthcare-related applications.
  • Experience with Tableau or BusinessObjects version upgrades. 2025 Business Intelligence (BI) Business Objects/S

job.title: EDW Informatica ETL Developer (32541)
job.description:
EDW Informatica ETL Developer

Job Title: Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) Informatica ETL Developer

Duration: 12 months with possible multi-year extension/s

Job Summary:

Clover Consulting (a Myticas Co.) is are seeking a highly experienced Informatica Extract Transform Load (ETL) Developer for a large, direct client in Springfield, IL. This opportunity will be an assent to the Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) team.

This role is responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining robust ETL processes using Informatica PowerCenter and Teradata. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of data integration, performance tuning, and data warehousing best practices, with a focus on supporting healthcare-related data systems.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design and implement ETL solutions using Informatica PowerCenter to extract, transform, and load data from various agency sources.
  • Automate data staging processes and optimize ETL job scheduling for performance and efficiency.
  • Administer and support ETL environments, including development and production systems.
  • Perform repository backups, recovery operations, and system maintenance.
  • Develop mappings, mapplets, sessions, and workflows using a wide range of Informatica transformations.
  • Monitor and troubleshoot ETL jobs across development, testing, and production environments.
  • Write and optimize complex SQL queries and Unix Shell scripts for data marts and interfaces in Teradata.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to define requirements, document technical solutions, and support project planning.
  • Participate in unit, integration, and system testing.
  • Provide technical support, mentoring, and guidance to team members.
  • Communicate project status and deliverables to leadership and clients.
  • Continuously learn and apply new technologies to enhance system performance and capabilities.

Required Qualifications:

  • 7+ years of experience with Informatica PowerCenter and ETL development.
  • 5+ years of experience writing complex SQL and performance tuning.
  • 5+ years of experience with Teradata (v17+), including Fastload, TPT, and Multiload utilities.
  • 5+ years of Informatica PowerCenter administration experience.
  • 2+ years of Unix Shell (Bash/Korn) scripting experience.
  • Strong communication, collaboration, and mentoring skills.
  • Bachelor’s or advanced degree in IT, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
  • Strong organizational and time management skills. 2025 Page 1 of 2 Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) ETL/Informatica Developer

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Residing in or near Springfield, IL.
  • 5+ years of data warehouse development experience.
  • 5+ years of data modeling experience using ERWIN or similar tools.
  • 2+ years of experience with Azure Data Factory and Snowflake.
  • Experience with scripting languages such as Python, R, or JavaScript (React).
  • Familiarity with Informatica Data Quality (IDQ), Address Doctor, and Metadata Manager.
  • Experience with Medicaid, Medicare, or healthcare data systems.
  • Experience working in Agile environments.
  • Knowledge of BI and data integration technologies across relational and multidimensional systems.

job.title: Senior Network Architect (32577)
job.description:
We are seeking an experienced and highly skilled Senior Network Architect with expertise in Segment Routing to join our dynamic and innovative team. As a Senior Network Architect, you will play a pivotal role in designing, implementing, and optimizing our network infrastructure, with a specific focus on segment routing technologies. Your deep understanding of network architecture, protocols, and best practices will contribute to the scalability, reliability, and performance of our network while ensuring alignment with business objectives.


The Sr. Network Architect is a Subject Matter Expert (SME) on all aspects of the LEO Network design and works with other LEO teams within Telesat and external contractors to ensure designs, implementation decisions, validation plans and documentation reflect the business requirements and objectives of the LEO program.

Main Responsibilities

  • Segment Routing Design and Implementation:
  • Participate in the design and implementation of segment routing solutions, ensuring optimal utilization of network resources and improved traffic engineering.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into effective network solution designs.
  • Develop strategies for partner business units to implement and manage network services implementations of segment routing architectures.
  • Network Architecture and Optimization:
  • Contribute to the architectural planning and evolution of the network, incorporating segment routing as a key technology.
  • Identify opportunities for optimization and enhanced performance using segment routing techniques, such as traffic steering, BSIDs and fast reroute mechanisms.
  • Perform network assessments and recommend improvements to maintain network health and operational efficiency.
  • Represent the LEO Network Engineering team by documenting and delivering network requirements to hardware and software development teams specifically in the areas of customer facing MEF 3.0 interface and networking design support requirements on data processing equipment
  • In coordination with Network team attend, contribute and produce materials for internal and external design and system engineering reviews for LEO Network Engineering related activities
  • Protocols and Standards:
  • Maintain a deep understanding of industry standards and protocols related to segment routing, such as IS-IS, BGP, and MPLS.
  • Stay updated with emerging trends and advancements in segment routing technologies, applying them to enhance network capabilities.
  • Troubleshooting and Problem Resolution:
  • Act as a subject matter expert, assist with complex network troubleshooting and incident resolution.
  • Collaborate with the LEO team to diagnose and address network behaviors and incidents in a timely manner, minimizing service disruptions.
  • Vendor and Solution Evaluation:
  • Evaluate new networking hardware, software, and solutions that align with segment routing strategies and network growth plans.
  • Collaborate with vendors to understand product roadmaps and provide feedback for feature enhancements.
  • Documentation and Knowledge Sharing:
  • Create and maintain detailed technical documentation, including network diagrams, configuration guidelines, and troubleshooting procedures related to segment routing.
  • Prepare and deliver materials including presentations, reference documentation and test strategies for LEO network equipment and applications deployment and operation
  • Share knowledge and mentor junior team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and skill development.
  • With LEO Network Engineers develop and oversee plans including product idea investigations, proof of concept, Service validation and product demonstrations in Telesat LEO labs

Education and Experience

  • 10+ years of experience in carrier network design, operation and deployment
  • Broad experience or exposure across all areas of network related product design, development, verification, deployment and support
  • Understanding of Metro Ethernet Forum (MEF) standards and objectives as they relate to Carrier Ethernet Services.
  • Knowledge of routing and switching protocols, including BGP, OSPF, IS-IS, and MPLS.
  • Experience with network automation and scripting using tools such as Python, Ansible, or similar.
  • Strong troubleshooting skills and the ability to diagnose and resolve complex network issues.
  • Demonstrated leadership skills and the ability to guide and mentor junior engineers.
  • In-depth understanding of security principles and practices as they relate to network architecture.
  • Proven experience in network design, architecture, and optimization.
  • Professional certifications such as Cisco CCIE, Juniper JNCIE, or equivalent, are highly desirable.
  • Comfortable leading meetings and able to communicate issues and trends to senior management and other groups at the appropriate level of detail.
  • Excellent communication (verbal, written, presentation) and interpersonal skills.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration abilities, with a proven track record of working effectively within cross-functional teams.
  • Communicates well with own team and across organizational boundaries to ensure the successful completion of shared goals.

job.title: Senior Data Warehouse Business Analyst (34075)
job.description:
Clover Consulting (a Myticas Co.) has a direct client in Springfield, IL in need of a Data Warehouse BA for a REMOTE, long-term contract.  Travel to Springfield may be required 2-4 times/year.  Qualified candidates please provide resume.   

Functional Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated Senior Business Analyst to support a large-scale Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) project. This role will serve as a critical liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams, ensuring that data warehouse solutions align with business goals. This role involves gathering and translating business requirements into functional specifications, supporting data modeling efforts, and facilitating testing and validation of data warehouse deliverables.
 
Primary Responsibilities
  • Collaborate with business users, data engineers, and BI developers to define and document business and data requirements.
  • Analyze existing data sources and business processes to identify gaps and opportunities for improvement.
  • Translate business needs into detailed functional and technical specifications for data warehouse development.
  • Support the design and implementation of ETL processes, interfaces, data marts, reports, and data analytics.
  • Work with our testing team to develop and execute test plans to validate data accuracy and integrity.
  • Facilitate user acceptance testing (UAT) and ensure stakeholder sign-off.
  • Create and maintain documentation including data dictionaries, process flows, and reporting specifications.
  • Act as a subject matter expert on data warehouse capabilities and best practices.
  • Support change management and training efforts related to new data solutions.
Required Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree or higher degree in business intelligence, analytics, computer science, engineering, or related STEM field.
  • 5+ years of healthcare business analysis experience supporting business initiatives through data analysis, writing business requirements and supporting testing of various systems.
  • Good understanding of Fee for Service (FFS), Managed Care claim adjudication processes from eligibility and enrollment to claims processing to funding/finance.
  • Experience working on a Medicaid Enterprise System (MES)/MMIS, or EDW DDI or equivalent.
  • Proficient in MS Word, MS Excel, MS Project, SharePoint, Teams, and MS PowerPoint.
  • Be a self-starter and able to thrive in an environment with little guidance.
  • Excellent interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills. 
  • Ability to effectively communicate findings clearly and concisely in writing and verbally to both technical and non-technical audiences
  • Ability to work in a challenging environment with multiple teams and competing priorities
  • Experience with facilitating meetings.
  • Effective organizational, analytical, time management, problem-solving, and multi-tasking skills
  • Ability to complete assignments under tight deadlines with little/no direct supervision.

job.title: Legal Analyst Attorney (34082)
job.description:
Myticas's direct client, based in Minneapolis, MN, is seeking a Legal Analyst/Attorney with J.D. for a hybrid contract position.

Job Title: Legal Analyst/Attorney with J.D.
Work Location: Hybrid, 2 days onsite/week at either of locations - Minneapolis, MN or Glastonbury, CT

Duration: 6+ month contract-to-Hire

 
NOTE: MUST HAVE,
  1. Juris Doctor (J.D.) degree.
  2. Ability to review documents.
  
JOB SUMMARY:
The Legal Invoice Analyst for client, Fulfilment Center of Excellence will be responsible for performing the quality assurance testing for the Legal Bill Analysis Center of Excellence (LBACOE).   
  
  • Understanding of legal terminology and claims legal situations, multijurisdictional exposure preferred.
  • Using sound discretion and legal expertise, analyze and condense legal service agreements to produce effective operational outputs meeting and in some cases exceeding customer expectations.

job.title: Cyber Posture Management Analyst (34098)
job.description:
Title: Cyber Posture Management Analyst

Type: Direct Hire

Location: Lansing, Michigan

Clover Consulting (a Myticas Co.) has a large, direct client seeking a skilled Cyber Posture Mgmt. Analyst I to join the team as part of their Information Security & Privacy team. This position provides security analysis for the company's Identity and Access Management (IAM) Operation's program. This role requires knowledge across multiple platforms, applications, processes, and procedures to enable access management of business initiatives across the enterprise.

Essential Responsibilities

  • Familiar with identity and access management, with a focus on Privileged Access Management (PAM), Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA), and Identity Governance and Administration (IGA).
  • Knowledge of scripting languages (e.g., PowerShell, Python) for automation and customization of IAM solutions.
  • Understanding of identity protocols and technologies: OpenID Connect (OIDC,) OAuth, SAML, AD-Fed, API Gateways, SCIM, and platforms such as, Sailpoint, CyberArk, and MS Entra.
  • Knowledge of identity & access management vulnerabilities, threats and mitigations.
  • Ability to determine how a security system works (including its resilience and dependability capabilities) and how changes in conditions, operations, or the environment will affect these outcomes.
  • Familiar with modern software life cycle development and automated cloud infrastructure deployment.
  • Understanding of network architecture, operating systems, and security protocols.
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
  • Supports initiatives and projects that will improve the organization’s cyber posture.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Understanding of security controls, risk management, and regulatory compliance (NIST CSF/SOX/GDPR/etc.).
  • Extended hours, including on-call may be required.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

  • Ability to receive and incorporate feedback.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Strong interpersonal, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
  • Flexibility in day-to-day work.
  • Ability to learn the company’s supported systems and their interfaces with other systems.
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft software applications.
  • Ability to communicate technical concepts in an understandable fashion.
  • Ability to prioritize multiple tasks and execute efficiently and effectively while demonstrating a clear sense of urgency when appropriate.
  • Excellent customer service focus and skills.
  • Ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment to achieve desired results.
  • Scripting knowledge preferred.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience and/or education required.
  • 1+ years knowledge of financial products, regulatory requirements, and business process preferred.
  • Cloud Identity experience preferred.
  • SC-300 Microsoft Certified Identity and Access Administrator Associate preferred.
  • CISSP Certified Information Systems Security Professional preferred.

job.title: Senior High-Speed Analog IC Design R&D Engineer (34222)
job.description:
You will be responsible for the development of integrated circuits operating at speeds greater than 100Gbaud for next-generation products. This role involves driving multiple aspects of IC product development, including circuit design, physical layout, and silicon bring-up. You will collaborate closely with teams across verification, CAD, product engineering, and test engineering to create and execute detailed design validation test (DVT) plans and device characterization strategies.

KEY SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

Minimum Experience Requirements:

  • Proven experience in high-speed analog IC design using SiGe BiCMOS or CMOS technologies

  • Strong understanding of transmission lines and other high-frequency passive components

  • Solid grasp of device physics and its influence on analog circuit performance, along with techniques to optimize performance

  • Hands-on experience with RF wafer probing, lab instrumentation, and evaluation of high-speed analog ICs

  • Familiarity with Verilog-A and scripting languages such as Skill, Python, or shell scripts is an asset

  • Excellent teamwork, verbal, and written communication skills

Education Requirements:

  • BS with 5+ years of relevant experience

  • MS with 3+ years of relevant experience

  • PhD with related academic or professional experience

job.title: Windchill Solutions Consultant (34225)
job.description:
Engineering Systems Consulting Application Engineer – Windchill
Contract to Hire
Hybrid – Grand Rapids, MI

Clover Consulting (a Myticas Co.) is seeking a consulting application engineer to support the delivery of the global team and initiatives for a large direct client in Grand Rapids.  As a member of the team, using Agile practices, you will lead to timely delivery of high-quality technical solutions that drive cross-functional business strategies and initiatives.
 
THE TEAM YOU WILL BE PART OF:
 
Our Engineering Systems team is a diverse and global team, supporting the people and systems in Product Lifecycle Management (PLM). Our mission is to empower our global PLM users to bring high quality products to market faster, using best-in-class technology, consistent processes and services, and trusted data that improves the product design, launch, manufacturing, and overall lifecycle management. To accomplish our mission we are continually improving and enhancing our PLM system which provides the foundation for the Digital Thread of connected product development data.  We are passionate about the product and services we deliver to our customers and value teamwork, customer service, and good communication to achieve team objectives and company strategic goals.
 
WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:
 
Key Responsibilities:
  • Actively seeks to identify breakthrough/game changing ideas for the business through the creative application of existing and emerging technologies.
  • Envisions, implements and supports solutions (technical or non-technical) to resolve business problems or improve business processes
  • Building relationships with and consulting with one or more client groups, either internal or external
  • Developing system requirements and identifying alternatives with associated costs for solutions that use Product Life Cycle Management technologies  
  • Implementing, deploying, maintaining, and upgrading solutions that use Product Life Cycle Management technologies. 
  • Lead legacy data migrations from non-Windchill systems into Windchill which includes mapping and logic definition, test method strategy, and run sheet definition.
 
Key Skills/Abilities:
  • Knowledge and understanding of Product Life Cycle Management business processes
  • Deep Windchill background that includes Workflow Design, Type and Attribute Management, Container Strategy and Access Control Policies, Object Initialization Rules, Life Cycle Definition, Team Templates, Change Process and Templates, Vaulting and Replication, Queue Management, 3D Publishing, Creo Parametric, Creo/Toolkit API, CAD Data Management, XBOM Management, Process Planning, Visual Work instructions, Parts Classification, Participant Administration with LDAP, Installation, Preferences and Properties, etc.
  • A bias for action and the ability to deal with ambiguity
  • Open minded, positive, can-do attitude
  • Ability to build trust with peers and help others when needed
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
  • Stays current with and provides leadership/direction to the corporation in the use of new or emerging technologies, technology enhancements and upgrades.
  • Ability to uncover the standard offerings of the technology and knowledge of the future direction of the technology/company
  • Architectural thinking - holistic thinking with a focus on integration and value add
  • Accomplished Project Management and organizational skills
  • Expert in communication of all forms (written, verbal, 1:1, large groups) to any audience (internal, external, peers, executives, etc.).
 
Technical Components of the position includes such tools and technologies as: 

PTC Products:                   Windchill, Creo, ESI/TIBCO, ThingWorx
ERP Systems:                    SAP ECC, SAP S/4
Programming Skills:       Java, JavaScript, SQL
Other:                                 MS Office Suite, MS Azure DevOps
 
Who You Are:

??We are looking for someone who is self-directed and has high initiative to join our Engineering Systems team.  You should be a strong relationship builder builder with excellent communication skills, who enjoys working on projects that are large, complex, and provide new and improved capabilities to our customers.  You should be flexible, driven, energetic, and have strong technical, critical thinking, and people skills to join our team.  ?Above all, you are service-focused, serving our team, customers, and IT as well teaching and leading others with empathy.?

Minimum Qualifications:
 
  • Bachelor’s Degree in a related field required. 
  • Five years of experience working with Windchill and PLM business processes.
  • Experience working in an Agile (SCRUM) environment preferred.
 
Preferred Qualifications:
 
  • Engineering, math, accounting concepts preferred.
  • Deep experience with PTC’s Windchill and Creo Integrated Change Management (ICM), Bill of Material (BOM) Transformation, Parts Classification, and Sustainability functionality.
  • Experience with integration between Windchill and ERP systems.
  • Experience working in an Agile (SCRUM) environment preferred.

job.title: Network Verification & Test Engineer (34227)
job.description:
We are seeking a Network Verification & Test Engineer to validate the performance, reliability, and compliance of advanced networking systems. This role involves creating verification plans, executing system-level tests, automating configurations, and working with industry-standard traffic generation tools. The ideal candidate will bring a strong networking background, hands-on testing expertise, and the ability to work both independently and in collaborative team settings.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop system and subsystem verification matrices to ensure full coverage of all system requirements.

  • Coordinate and participate in system-level testing activities, including planning, execution, and reporting of results.

  • Design, develop, and maintain test cases and test beds to support various testing scenarios.

  • Execute tests using traffic generators (e.g., Spirent, IXIA, Test Center), packet capture tools (tcpdump), and performance tools (iPerf).

  • Validate networking features and performance across OSI layers, including TCP, UDP, IP networking, routing protocols, and network optimization techniques.

  • Implement and manage NETCONF and gRPC/gNMI for automated network device configuration.

  • Work with structured data formats such as JSON, JSON IETF, XML, YAML, PROTO, and REST APIs to support automation workflows.

  • Utilize Kubernetes (POD) and Docker containers for test environment setup and management.

  • Troubleshoot and resolve performance and functional issues, ensuring timely defect identification and resolution.

Required Qualifications

  • Proven experience with traffic generation and analysis tools such as Spirent, IXIA, Test Center, tcpdump, and iPerf.

  • Strong understanding of networking fundamentals, including OSI layers, TCP/UDP/IP protocols, routing protocols, and optimization methods.

  • Experience configuring and automating network devices using NETCONF and gRPC/gNMI.

  • Proficiency with structured data formats (JSON, XML, YAML, PROTO) and REST API integration.

  • Familiarity with Kubernetes and Docker environments.

  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.

  • Ability to work independently and within cross-functional teams.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with Python or Ansible for network automation and orchestration.

  • Prior experience in network verification, system integration testing, or telecom/network equipment validation.

  • Exposure to performance benchmarking and large-scale test environments.

job.title: Product Security Architect (34252)
job.description:
Product Security Architect

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Product Security Architect to join our team and help secure next-generation satellite systems. Reporting to the Senior Manager, Product Security, you will be responsible for embedding security throughout the product lifecycle — from design and development to deployment and operations — ensuring the integrity, confidentiality, and availability of our space and ground-based assets.

Main Responsibilities

  • Threat Modeling & Risk Assessment: Conduct threat modeling and security risk assessments for satellite hardware, software, and communication systems.

  • Secure Design & Architecture: Collaborate with engineering teams to design secure systems, including onboard satellite software, ground control systems, and data links.

  • Vulnerability Management: Evaluate and support remediation efforts related to vulnerabilities in embedded systems, firmware, and satellite communication protocols.

  • Security Testing: Propose test use cases and review testing results for assessments such as penetration testing, fuzzing, and static/dynamic code analysis on satellite and ground systems.

  • Compliance & Standards: Ensure compliance with industry standards/frameworks such as NIST, ISO 27001, and space-specific cybersecurity frameworks (e.g., CCSDS, CNSSI 1253).

  • Incident Response: Create concepts of operation for incident detection, analysis, and response to security events affecting satellite products.

  • Tooling & Automation: Ensure the software development lifecycle follows industry best practices and utilize appropriate security tools to automate security checks.

  • Collaboration: Work cross-functionally with software, hardware, systems, and mission assurance teams to champion security best practices.

Education/Experience

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Cybersecurity, or a related field.

  • 10+ years of experience in product or embedded security architecture.

  • Experience in the aerospace or satellite industry.

  • Certifications such as CISSP, OSCP, CEH, or GIAC.

Specialized Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

  • Strong understanding of embedded systems security, real-time operating systems (RTOS), and secure communications.

  • Knowledge of space system architectures, including satellite buses, payloads, and ground stations.

  • Extensive understanding of the space industry threat landscape.

  • Experience with security tools (e.g., SAST, DAST, Splunk).

  • Knowledge of cybersecurity frameworks (e.g., NIST 800-53, ISO/IEC 27001).

  • Familiarity with space situational awareness (SSA) and anti-jamming/anti-spoofing techniques.

  • Experience with DevSecOps in aerospace environments.

job.title: Technical Lead – FPGA & Real-Time Systems (2 Positions) (34258)
job.description:
Technical Lead – FPGA & Real-Time Systems

We are looking for an experienced FPGA Technical Lead to guide high-performance design and development projects. This is a hands-on leadership role focused on technical direction rather than people management. You’ll work closely with architects, hardware/software teams, and product leaders to deliver cutting-edge systems used in large-scale, real-time environments.

What You’ll Do
  • Lead FPGA design activities including RTL development, verification, and optimization.
  • Collaborate with system and product architects to define design specifications.
  • Drive efficiency and reliability in high-volume real-time processing (video, audio, or imaging).
  • Ensure delivery milestones are met, flagging issues early and helping the team stay on track.
  • Provide technical input on toolsets, methodologies, and best practices.
  • Participate in design reviews, release planning, and technical hiring decisions.
  • Mentor team members and contribute to knowledge sharing.

What You Bring
  • 5+ years of FPGA & hardware development experience in production environments.
  • Proven expertise in RTL design, FPGA building blocks, and high-speed interfaces (DDR4/5, PCIe, transceivers, PLLs).
  • Strong Verilog/SystemVerilog coding and verification skills; familiarity with C/C++ is an asset.
  • Hands-on experience with Xilinx (AMD) and Intel (Altera) FPGA devices and toolchains.
  • Background in real-time systems (RTOS), ideally with video, audio, or imaging data.
  • Knowledge of data compression, parallel processing, and 4K optimization.
  • Experience building solutions for mass production, not just prototypes or research.
  • Strong communication, organizational, and leadership skills.
  • Degree in Engineering or related field (or equivalent technical experience).

Why Join
This is an opportunity to play a pivotal role in developing next-generation FPGA solutions for high-volume, real-time applications. You’ll have the chance to lead technically, solve complex challenges, and help shape products from concept to production.

job.title: FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer, Intermediate (2 Positions) (34259)
job.description:
FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer
 

We are seeking an FPGA/Hardware Engineer to help design and optimize advanced media transport and processing systems for high-performance video, audio, and data applications. This role involves hands-on design, testing, and support of production-grade solutions.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop FPGA-based solutions for video/audio transport and real-time processing (SMPTE ST 2110/IP, SDI).

  • Implement and optimize RTL designs, with a focus on 4K performance, data compression, and parallel processing.

  • Support hardware testing, debugging, and validation in lab environments.

  • Contribute to new product introduction (NPI) through design, documentation, and test activities.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams on requirements, component selection, and technical documentation.

What We’re Looking For

  • 2+ years of FPGA or hardware design experience (video/audio focus preferred).

  • Hands-on experience with Intel and/or Xilinx FPGA platforms and design tools.

  • Proficiency with SystemVerilog (preferred), VHDL, or HLS; scripting in TCL/SDC.

  • Familiarity with high-speed interfaces (Ethernet, DDR), transceivers, and timing analysis.

  • Strong problem-solving, debugging, and communication skills.

Nice to Have

  • Exposure to Linux-based development and programming in C/C++ or Python.

  • Knowledge of digital video/audio standards (SDI, AES, NMOS) and broadcast workflows.

  • Experience with packet processing, routing protocols, or PTP synchronization.

job.title: Senior, FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer (2 Positions) (34260)
job.description:
Senior FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer

We’re looking for a seasoned FPGA / Hardware Design Engineer to help architect and deliver next-generation solutions for high-performance video and data applications. This role involves taking projects from concept through to production, with a strong focus on efficiency, optimization, and real-time system performance.

What You’ll Do

  • Lead FPGA and hardware design efforts, from architecture through testing and validation.

  • Define requirements, select components, and contribute to schematic/board design decisions.

  • Develop, verify, and debug FPGA-based solutions (including UHD-SDI, high-speed transceivers, DDR interfaces, etc.).

  • Support the full product development lifecycle (design, QA, documentation, customer-facing support).

  • Collaborate across teams to ensure high-performance, production-ready solutions.

What You Bring

  • Strong background in RTL design and FPGA development (VHDL/Verilog).

  • Experience with real-time operating systems (RTOS), ideally in video, audio, or image processing.

  • Proven ability in high-volume data processing, compression, and parallel processing for 4K optimization.

  • Hands-on expertise with modern FPGA platforms (Xilinx, Intel/Altera) and related tools.

  • Familiarity with SoC integration, clock domain analysis, and timing closure.

  • Solid understanding of circuit design (power, signal integrity, microprocessor design).

  • Proficiency in debugging with lab tools (oscilloscopes, analyzers, WFMs, etc.).

  • Additional experience with C/C++/Java, scripting, and broadcast workflows is a plus.

job.title: Senior FPGA / RTL Design Engineer - EDGE Technologies (2 Positions) (34261)
job.description:
Senior FPGA / RTL Design Engineer

Overview

We are seeking an experienced FPGA / RTL Design Engineer to join our development team. This role is focused on architecting and delivering advanced FPGA solutions in high-performance, production-grade environments. You’ll work closely with cross-functional teams to design, verify, and optimize systems used in data-intensive, real-time applications.

Key Responsibilities

  • Architect, design, simulate, and test advanced FPGA-based solutions.

  • Define high-level design requirements and support product development.

  • Collaborate with hardware, software, and verification teams to validate designs.

  • Lead technical design reviews and resolve complex issues.

  • Produce high-quality documentation to support new product introduction.

  • Participate in Agile/Scrum ceremonies and contribute to continuous improvement.

  • Mentor junior team members and share technical expertise.

Core Skills & Experience

  • 6+ years of FPGA development experience; background with video/audio systems an asset.

  • Strong RTL design skills using Verilog/SystemVerilog.

  • Expertise in FPGA workflows (RTL capture, synthesis, timing closure, prototyping, release).

  • Hands-on debugging with simulations and in-FPGA logic analyzers.

  • Familiarity with SoC interconnects (AXI, Avalon), high-speed protocols (PCIe, Ethernet, HDMI, SDI, DisplayPort), and compression standards (e.g., HEVC, AVC).

  • Knowledge of FPGA development tools such as Vivado and Quartus.

  • Additional programming knowledge (C, C++, Python) considered an advantage.

What We’re Looking For

  • Strong problem-solving ability with a focus on performance, efficiency, and optimization.

  • Organized, detail-oriented, and capable of working independently or in a team.

  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to explain technical concepts to diverse audiences.

  • A degree in Engineering (or equivalent experience).

job.title: AWS Cloud/DevOps Engineer (34262)
job.description:
Title: AWS Cloud/DevOps Engineer
Location: Chicago, IL 60604 (Hybrid, 4 days onsite/week)
Duration: 1 Year contract (Possible extension)

*NOTE: W2 Contract ONLY, 

TOP 3 skills:
  1. Experience with CI/build tools, Pipelines
  2. AWS Cloud
  3. CI/CD (GitLab)

Nice to Have:
  1. Terraform
  2. Scripting (PowerShell/Python)
  3. Some development background

Description
The Senior Cloud/DevOps Engineer leads the design, maintenance, transition to, and operations of cloud platforms. The Engineer collaborates with stakeholders to obtain and translate business requirements into technical implementations and provides guidance to technical teams regarding architectural and procedural best practices and functional experience. This position is considered advanced level and performs work of moderate to high complexity. The incumbent works under general supervision and may lead some efforts autonomously. This position does not have any direct reports but may lead or mentor of junior staff.

PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Leads the technical design, maintenance, and operation of cloud-based platforms.
  • Leads automation efforts to minimize manual work and ensure transparency in all aspects of the secure cloud ecosystem.
  • Implements hybrid IT by integrating different cloud services with back-end, traditional data center services.
  • Migrates legacy applications to public cloud services in a rehosting approach or in a revising approach for efficiency, agility, and disaster recovery.
  • Partners with stakeholders to obtain and translate requirements into technical implementations.
  • Integrates existing legacy systems with proposed systems by identifying gaps between the current and future state.
  • Oversees and develops continuous delivery framework and tools.
  • Develops testing use cases and detailed testing plans that map to the documented business and technical requirements.
  • Leads technical and end-user resources to execute detailed tests and analyze testing results.
  • Assists with implementation of customer side monitoring tools and may lead operation outage events.
  • Provides timely/responsive technical support including rotational on call support.

job.title: SAP EWM Lead (Contract) – Hybrid Winnipeg (34267)
job.description:
We’re seeking an experienced SAP EWM Lead to drive warehousing design and delivery for a large S/4HANA program. This role is a long term, client-facing, hands-on, and requires frequent onsite presence in Winnipeg.

Responsibilities

  • Lead EWM solution design & build across inbound, outbound, and internal processes

  • Configure warehouse structures (Storage Types/Sections, Activity Areas), RF, POSC/LOSC, WOCR, picking/putaway strategies

  • Integrate EWM with MM and SD; partner with process & technical teams on end-to-end flows

  • Run workshops, create business blueprints, document requirements, and present to stakeholders

  • Troubleshoot complex issues; provide cutover and hypercare leadership

Required Qualifications

  • 10+ years SAP EWM experience

  • 3+ full lifecycle EWM implementations in a consulting capacity

  • Proven, hands-on configuration across all core EWM areas listed above

  • Strong client-facing communication & presentation skills; ability to translate technical to business language

  • Solid analytical/problem-solving skills; proactive, collaborative, accountable, able to work independently

Nice to Have

  • Industry exposure in Power & Utilities, Oil & Gas, Energy

  • S/4HANA EWM 2023 experience

Work Model

  • Hybrid Winnipeg: up to 4 days/week on site (approx. 75% travel required)

job.title: Senior ASIC Product Engineer (34268)
job.description:
Myticas is seeking a highly skilled and motivated ASIC Product Engineer to join our clients team. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing specifications and validation methods for Analog ASICs used in datacenter transceiver products. This role involves close collaboration with multiple teams on product definition, requirements, specifications, DVT, qualification, test, and production ramp-up. The ideal candidate will be proactive, able to anticipate problems, and devise effective solutions.
 

 
HOW YOU WILL CONTRIBUTE AND WHAT YOU WILL LEARN
  • Translate system requirements for datacenter communication ICs into detailed specifications and ensure compliance through design, test, and validation processes.
  • Develop and maintain application notes to support the integration of these ICs.
  • Serve as the liaison between the ASIC design team and module-level HW integration and test teams.
  • Drive the supply of prototype ASICs for performance and reliability validation activities.
  • Perform statistical data analysis on large datasets to characterize and improve product performance.
  • Track, troubleshoot, and resolve IC issues in collaboration with the design team.
  • Evaluate capabilities, yields, and supply planning in preparation for volume ramp following product release.
KEY SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
  • Proven experience in product engineering, working cross-functionally to bring ASICs to market through multiple development cycles.
  • Experience working with analog ASICs with proven ability to evaluate performance and lead failure analysis
  • Strong understanding of device physics and its impact on analog circuits, with techniques to improve performance.
  • Proficiency in working with large datasets, performing statistical analysis, and presenting data and ideas to diverse audiences.
  • Excellent organizational and information management skills.
  • Demonstrated ability to enhance proficiency through programming skills and process development.

job.title: Sr Java/AWS Developer (34280)
job.description:
Title: Sr Java/AWS Developer
Location: Chicago, IL 60604 (On-site Work)

Principal Duties and Responsibilities:

job.title: Infrastructure Manager - Linux Subject Matter Expert (34285)
job.description:
The Manager will serve as a Linux Subject Matter Expert (SME), responsible for monitoring, maintaining, troubleshooting, and supporting high-performance computing (HPC) nodes that are critical to our client’s day-to-day operations. The role focuses on ensuring a secure, optimized, and highly available HPC environment, while delivering deep technical expertise and guidance to users and internal teams.
Candidates must be able to work onsite at least 4 days per week.
Key Responsibilities
  • Act as the primary technical expert for Linux-based HPC clusters – ensuring performance, capacity, and availability targets are met.
  • Identify, diagnose, and resolve complex second-level issues for hardware, software, network, VPN, and Linux environments; escalate as needed with full documentation.
  • Manage daily operations of Linux-based HPC environments, including patching, upgrades, security hardening, and configuration of Ubuntu and RedHat systems.
  • Support job submission and workload management using Slurm or OpenHPC, and assist end users in optimizing compute workloads.
  • Migrate existing nodes to Linux, ensuring minimal downtime and performance impact.
  • Implement and manage cluster patching/automation tools such as Foreman (or similar) to streamline operations.
  • Install and configure servers, storage, hypervisors (KVM), and other HPC infrastructure components.
  • Automate administrative tasks to improve operational efficiency.
  • Execute firewall access requests, monitor security alerts, and assist in incident response.
  • Provide second-level support and mentorship to junior technical staff, ensuring knowledge transfer and consistent process execution.
  • Develop, maintain, and publish technical documentation, KB articles, and end-user guides for new systems or upgrades.
  • Participate in on-call rotations, emergency incident response, and occasional after-hours maintenance windows.
Education & Experience
  • Diploma or Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
  • Minimum 2+ years in IT (with a related University Degree) or 7+ years in IT (with a three-year College Diploma).
  • Enterprise-level Linux expertise (Ubuntu and/or RedHat) is essential.
  • Certifications (e.g., MCSE, CISSP) are strong assets.
Specialized Skills
  • Proven track record as a Linux SME in installation, tuning, and operational support.
  • In-depth experience with HPC clusters and job scheduling tools such as Slurm, LSF, or GridEngine.
  • Strong knowledge of KVM or similar hypervisors.
  • Working understanding of network systems, protocols, and standards including Active Directory integration.
  • Identity management experience (Microsoft Identity Manager, Azure AD Connect).
  • Solid scripting skills (Bash required; additional scripting languages are an asset).
  • Experience applying advanced troubleshooting to resolve performance, configuration, or security issues.
  • Excellent problem-solving, organizational, and documentation skills.
  • Ability to communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Bilingualism (English/French) is an asset.
  • Microsoft Windows knowledge is an asset.
Decision Making & Supervision
  • Operate with minimal supervision while making decisions based on analysis, troubleshooting, and established procedures.
  • Coordinate with helpdesk, networking, platform, and security teams to ensure alignment of upgrades, patches, and operations.
Working Conditions
  • Comfortable office environment with periodic physical tasks (e.g., installing hardware).
  • Requires appropriate security clearance.
  • Must be willing to provide occasional off-hours support and participate in on-call rotation.

job.title: Technical Architect (34292)
job.description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Technical Architect to design and implement robust technology architectures, frameworks, and strategies that align with business objectives and application requirements. The successful candidate will evaluate solutions, ensure integration across systems, and provide leadership in adopting emerging technologies, while mentoring and guiding teams to build sustainable and scalable solutions. This role requires Canadian Government Secret Clearance at minimum.

Key Responsibilities

  • Architecture & Strategy: Develop technical architectures, frameworks, and strategies to address organizational and major application needs.

  • Policy Alignment: Identify and interpret the policies, standards, and requirements that influence solution design.

  • Solution Evaluation: Analyze and assess alternative technology solutions to determine the most effective approach to business challenges.

  • Integration Leadership: Ensure seamless integration of all components within technology solutions.

  • Trend Monitoring: Stay current with industry and government technology trends to align solutions with evolving directions.

  • Innovation & Emerging Tech: Provide insight, direction, and support for the adoption of emerging technologies.

  • Impact Analysis: Conduct impact assessments of proposed technology changes on systems and operations.

  • Support & Guidance: Collaborate with application development and technical support teams to ensure optimal use of infrastructure.

  • Standards & Performance: Review application and infrastructure designs for compliance with standards, recommending enhancements for performance and scalability.

  • Executive Communication: Assist in the preparation of materials and deliver presentations to senior leadership as required.

  • Mentorship & Collaboration: Coach, mentor, and collaborate with colleagues to enhance organizational capability in architecture and solution development.

Qualifications

  • Proven experience as a Technical Architect, Solutions Architect, or related senior technical role.

  • Strong knowledge of enterprise architecture frameworks, IT standards, and best practices.

  • Expertise in analyzing complex business problems and designing scalable technology solutions.

  • Familiarity with emerging technologies, cloud computing, integration platforms, and IT governance.

  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, with experience influencing senior leadership.

  • Demonstrated ability to mentor, coach, and collaborate effectively across teams.

  • Must hold active Canadian Government Secret Clearance.

Preferred Skills

  • Experience working in public sector or regulated industries.

  • Knowledge of compliance, data security, and government IT standards.

  • Professional certifications in architecture (e.g., TOGAF, Zachman, AWS/Azure Architect) are an asset.

job.title: Regulatory Registration and Raw Material Scientist (34313)
job.description:
Clover Consulting has a direct client in Grand Rapids, MI in need of a Regulatory Technician for a 6-month - 3 years contract.  This is a Hybrid role requiring on site Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday.

Job title: Regulatory Registration and Raw Material Scientist
                
What’s special about this team:
The Regulatory Affairs & Safety department functions as a progressive global group that ensures product compliance and safety in every step of the product lifecycle. Working with cross-functional teams we provide counsel on ingredient acceptability, formulation design, product labeling, claims, and registration requirements. If you would enjoy working on a technical, global, cross functional team, this is a terrific opportunity to showcase your skills!
 
How you would contribute to the role:
In this role, you will be a key team member supporting regulatory assessment of raw materials for global acceptability as well as registration of Beauty and Homecare products in global markets. You will work in close partnership with Regulatory Analysts leading ITM projects and Supply Chain Sourcing Managers working on continuous supply of ingredients for Amway products. You will have an opportunity to connect with regulatory partners in global markets and directly contribute to project execution.
 
 What skills and background will be important for success:
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Two to three years of work experience (Regulatory, Science, Health/Nutrition, International Affairs or related degree), ideally with use of analytical and scientific databases.
  • Knowledge of Beauty and Homecare regulations.
  • A solution-oriented mindset.
  • Talent to communicate across cultures, with the ability to influence stakeholders.
  • BS degree in Regulatory Science or a related sciences discipline
  • This position is NOT eligible for sponsorship

job.title: Remote-Cyber Risk Analyst (34316)
job.description:
Title: Cyber Risk Analyst (NIST 800 series)

Location:  100% Remote (Client Based at Lemont, IL-60439) 

Duration: 12 Months Contract with Potential of Extension


NOTE:  Must be a US Citizen.

Job Description:
The Cyber Risk Analyst will play an important role in identifying and communicating areas of concern and risks to the business. This engagement will free up other cybersecurity resources to work in other critical areas. The ideal candidate will need to:
 
  1. Possess a working level expertise with the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) Risk Management Framework (RMF) and the NIST 800-53 series of control families and approaches.
  2. Perform detailed analysis and a cyber risk assessment of Cloud Service Providers (CSPs).
  3. Engage with vendors to review controls, certifications, and risks in support of the associated business need and the laboratory’s risk tolerance.
  4. Partner with the CSPO in the development of risk assessment and reporting processes within the Laboratory’s Governance, Risk and Compliance (GRC) tool, Talatek TiGRIS.
  5. Partner with others from within the CSPO team and Laboratory IT environment to perform risk-based assessments of NIST 800-53 control validation and gap analysis.
  6. Collaborate with the CSPO to present outcomes of risk analysis work using presentation methods to CSPO and other lab audiences (IT admins, Deputy CIO, CISO)
  7. Maintain assessment and assessment results in identified repositories, e.g., the Lab’s GRC tool, Talatek TiGRIS, MS Excel, Box or Box+
  8. Assist in the performance of the laboratory’s Divisional Site Assist Visit (DSAV) self-assessment and continuous monitoring strategy, assessing the cyber security controls and their implementation in various programmatic spaces.
Objectives:
The ideal candidate will have:
  • A fundamental understanding of IT Risk management and the NIST 800 series framework.
  • Experience with government environments.
  • Experience working closely with cyber security leadership and peers along with IT system/process owners to capture artifacts for control testing.
  • Technical understanding of systems and technologies to inform audits and assessments.
  • Ability to translate results into business-oriented, task-focused presentations.
  • The ideal candidate will support the projects and tasks associated with Cybersecurity Risk Assessment and Compliance.
  • Ability to support urgency and timeliness expectations, assuring risk assessments are completed to support DOE Authority to Operate and Authority to Use deadlines.
Required Qualifications/Skills:
  • Considerable knowledge of Risk Management and Risk Management Framework (RMF) requirements
  • Working level knowledge of the NIST 800 Rev 5 series framework
  • Considerable knowledge/experience of assessing controls.
  • Knowledge of industry-standard and organizationally accepted analysis principles and methods.
  • Experience in working with Governance Risk Compliance systems.
  • Experience presenting reports and outcomes to leadership, tracking to closure, and creating buy-in to risk management.
  • Experience and skill in conducting audits or reviews of technical systems.
  • Experience assessing vendor risk.
  • Skill in identifying measures or indicators of system performance and the actions needed to improve or correct performance, relative to the goals of the system.
  • Ability to skillfully communicate through various methods. This includes written documentation. The audience will be leaders and executives. Finalists may be asked to complete a brief, job-relevant writing exercise. 
  • Ability to work autonomously as a contributing member of a small technical team
  • Experience working in a government environment.
  • Experience working in a distributed IT environment.
  • Basic knowledge of cyber security concepts.
  • Working knowledge of networking administration.
  • Working knowledge of system administration.
  • Ability to qualify for HSPD-12 card for use in two-factor authentication.
  • Able to effectively interact with user organizations to validate controls.
  • Able to effectively disseminate knowledge to current staff.

job.title: Senir AWS DevOps Specialist (34328)
job.description:
Job Title: Senior AWS DevOps Specialist (Contract)
Location: Remote within Canada
Duration: 3 months to start

Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Senior AWS DevOps Specialist to support cloud infrastructure and automation initiatives. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in designing, implementing, and managing AWS cloud solutions, with expertise in CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure as code, monitoring, and security best practices.

Responsibilities:

  • Implement and manage CI/CD pipelines (e.g., Jenkins, GitHub Actions, GitLab CI).

job.title: Data Engineer (Remote - Canada) (34327)
job.description:
Job Title: Data Engineer (Contract)
Location: Remote (Canada)

Overview:
We are seeking a skilled Data Engineer with strong experience in Databricks and AWS Cloud. This is a contract position, fully remote within Canada. The ideal candidate has hands-on experience building, optimizing, and maintaining scalable data solutions in a cloud-based environment.

  • Build and maintain scalable solutions on AWS Cloud.

job.title: Performance and Optimization Specialist (34329)
job.description:
We are looking for a Performance & Optimization Specialist for one of our clients to perform network performance, monitoring, and analysis by collecting and analyzing information, identifying the abnormalities from sources in the domain of the customer solution, diagnosing root causes of performance issues, and recommending improvement for optimization actions (i.e., QoS Optimization, parameter tuning, SW Upgrades, etc.) to meet contractual KPI targets. They find problems that were not identified during testing. In addition to diagnosing network performance issues, the Performance & Optimization Specialist generates daily/weekly/monthly reports related to technology aspects of the customer solution. The specialist performs short-term capacity utilization and traffic pattern assessments to evaluate impact on current and future architecture and recommend optimal network strategy for future traffic/capacity needs, leveraging automation techniques to reduce analysis time and other optimization related activities that involve repetition.
Required Soft skills:
a) Strong communication skills
b) Self starter who will use own deep technical expertise to assess the network configuration and come up with feature/parameter trial plan independently.
c) Ability to interact/engage customer for technical discussions, review of technical reports/analysis/recommendations
d) NAM Time zone support

Required Technical Skill Set:
1. Strong understanding of 5G NSA, SA (FDD & TDD) and LTE.
2. Past hands-on experience with trials/optimization projects for 5G NSA/SA with demonstrated experience on 5G Features for Coverage optimization (e.g. SRS Beamforming), Throughput optimization, Load balancing, layering and Traffic Steering from low to high bands..
3. Past hands-on experience with trials/optimization projects for LTE with demonstrated experience on 4G Features for Data/VoLTE Drop call improvement, Load balancing, Layering and Traffic Steering from low to high bands.
4. Ability to analyze internal syslogs, eNB/gNB EMIL/DCAP logs, TTI traces for quick troubleshooting and issue resolution for lab or field activities.
5. Expertise with UE and eNB/gNB signaling log analysis (UU, X2, S1 signaling)
6. Exposure with UE logging tools such as QXDM, XCAL, or equivalent and should be proficient with those tools.
7. Experience with Actix post processing of DT logs.

Job Responsibilities
1. Performs critical (sometimes escalated) design and performance activities in customer projects independently (complex problem solving in projects and multi-vendor environments).
2. Develops / Reviews and makes recommendations on network-wide Design covering Performance, Spectrum & Capacity supported by Recommendations (within and across the region).
3. Organizes field measurements and laboratory tests. Performs network audits, especially in cases where fault or problems exist.
4. Optimizes networks with all components based on traffic trends and customer forecasts.
5. Supports experts in developing network configuration file and interface analysis

Project Specific Roles
1. I. LTE LMS assessment and LTE Features evaluation and executing trials for Load balancing, traffic steering campaigns for movement from low to high bands.
II. LTE and VoLTE Drop call rate improvement via troubleshooting configuration issues, analysis of counters and coming up with trial plan for KPI improvement based on feature trials and parameter tuning (not look for RF shaping skillset)
III. 5G LMS assessment and 5G Features evaluation and executing trials for 5G DL/UL Throughput improvement, Coverage improvement and traffic steering from low to high bands.
IV. Troubleshooting hot topics via OSS KPIs, TTI traces, EMIL traces etc

job.title: Director, Government Business Development & Proposals (34332)
job.description:
Location: Remote (Canada)
Type: Full-time, Permanent

About the Role
Our client, a global leader in advanced technology solutions, is seeking a Director of Business Development (Government Contracts). This role will spearhead expansion into federal, provincial, state, and international government markets. You’ll lead the full lifecycle of government proposals, build strategic partnerships, and secure funding/contracts that support climate action and space innovation.

What You’ll Do
  • Develop and execute a government contracting strategy.
  • Identify, qualify, and pursue opportunities with agencies (CSA, ESA, NASA, DoD, ECCC, etc.).
  • Lead government proposal writing and management (RFI, RFP, RFQ, grants, tenders).
  • Build and maintain trusted relationships with public sector stakeholders.
  • Negotiate teaming agreements and subcontractor partnerships.
  • Provide pipeline analysis and capture strategy updates to leadership.


What We’re Looking For
  • 8–10+ years of business development/proposal management in aerospace, defense, cleantech, or government contracting.
  • Proven track record leading winning multi-million-dollar proposals.
  • Familiarity with procurement systems (MERX, Buyandsell.gc.ca, SAM.gov, ESA EMITS, NASA NSPIRES).
  • Strong persuasive writing, capture management, and negotiation skills.
  • Bachelor’s degree required; Master’s or APMP certification is an asset.

Why This Role?
Join a mission-driven organization that leverages cutting-edge technology to make global impact, while shaping strategy at the intersection of environment, defense, and innovation.

job.title: SAP S4 Business Analyst (34331)
job.description:
Our client is preparing for an SAP S/4HANA transformation and needs an experienced SAP Business Analyst to lead discovery and documentation of current-state processes across multiple functions and support migration-readiness activities.

What you’ll do

  • Run workshops to identify and document current business processes that leverage SAP ECC across Supply Chain, HCM, Finance, Procurement, and Facilities.

  • Develop strategies & templates to map processes consistently at the right level of detail for migration assessment.

  • Document current-state processes including roles/responsibilities and role headcount.

  • Analyze processes to identify gaps and optimization opportunities.

  • Partner with business & 3rd-party vendors to help document future-state processes where required.

  • Create test plans & test cases for UAT in SAP S/4HANA.

Required experience

  • Proven BA experience on SAP ECC programs, with exposure to S/4HANA initiatives.

  • Strong facilitation and documentation skills (workshops, process maps, RACI/roles).

  • Hands-on in writing UAT plans/test cases and driving user testing.

  • Excellent stakeholder communication across business and IT.

Nice to have

  • Background in ECC-S/4 migration assessments.

  • Familiarity with tools like Visio/ARIS, Azure DevOps/Jira, Solution Manager/ChaRM.

  • Public sector or healthcare experience.

Work model & compliance

job.title: S4 HANA Migration Architect (34333)
job.description:
Our client is launching a 2–2.5 year SAP ECC ? S/4HANA modernization. The S/4HANA Migration Architect will provide leadership across design, migration strategy, testing readiness, and stakeholder alignment to ensure a smooth transition to a cloud-based S/4HANA environment with no disruption to business operations.

Key Responsibilities

  • Advise on strategy, approach, and risks for the ECC to S/4HANA migration across Finance, Procurement, Supply Chain, HCM, and Facilities.

  • Facilitate communication across stakeholders and technology partners; identify & mitigate risks.

  • Support RFPs, business cases, OCM activities; prepare executive-ready documents, reports, and presentations.

Required Skills & Experience

Assets (Nice to Have)

job.title: Analytics Lead (34338)
job.description:
Description
We are a cutting-edge technology company specializing in advanced emissions monitoring and analytics. By operating proprietary satellite and aircraft sensors, and combining these with third-party data, we power an analytics pipeline that delivers actionable environmental and business insights.
This pipeline enables us to:
  • Identify and classify potential emission sources with precision.
  • Detect and quantify emissions through accurate measurements.
  • Provide intelligence to customers that drives innovation, compliance, and positive environmental outcomes.
Our structured, distributed datastore underpins this work, housing acquired data, intermediate artifacts, and pipeline outputs—an asset of significant value to analysts and aggregators worldwide.
The Opportunity
We’re seeking a visionary and hands-on Analytics Lead who will be instrumental in scaling and optimizing our analytics capabilities. Reporting to the VP of Software, you will build and lead a high-performing team of technical and subject matter experts to expand the geographical and industrial reach of our solutions.
You will act as both architect and builder of our next-generation data platform, implementing scalable analytical solutions. Beyond technical execution, you will collaborate closely with Product teams to ensure these capabilities translate into innovative features that meet evolving customer needs. This role is ideal for a technical leader who thrives on complex data challenges and understands how foundational data systems drive product innovation.

What You’ll Do
  • Technical Leadership & Development: Lead by example, providing hands-on expertise in building, optimizing, and maintaining analytics systems from ingestion to insights.
  • Data & Algorithm Innovation: Evaluate and integrate new data sources, algorithms, and emerging technologies that enhance monitoring and prediction capabilities.
  • Datastore Optimization: Design and refine datastore mechanisms, ensuring efficient data flow, integrity, and scalability.
  • Product Collaboration: Partner with Product teams to align data initiatives with business goals, enabling new customer-facing features.
  • Stay Ahead of Trends: Continuously research and integrate new technologies, ensuring our analytics remain at the forefront of the industry.
  • Team Leadership: Recruit, mentor, and grow a world-class analytics team with a culture of excellence and continuous learning.
  • Clear Communication: Articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, supporting informed strategic decisions.
Requirements
  • Engineering & Architecture Expertise: Proven experience as a developer, engineer, or architect in modern data and geospatial systems.
  • Strategic Vision: Ability to define and execute a data infrastructure roadmap aligned with organizational and product strategies.
  • Cross-Functional Collaboration: Track record of working effectively with product, engineering, and business teams.
  • People Leadership: Strong management skills, with success in mentoring high-performing teams.
  • Executive Communication: Skilled in presenting complex information to senior leadership and boards.
  • Education: Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related quantitative field.
  • Security Clearance: Must be eligible to obtain security clearance. (5+ years living in Canada)

job.title: Civil Engineer (34310)
job.description:
Civil Engineer 
Location: Salt Lake City, UT or Kansas City, MO
Salary: $124,800 - $187,200 (can exceed based on experience)

The Civil Engineer will use theoretical knowledge and practical design methodology for civil site design. The incumbent will design/configure the planning of site layout, design proposed utilities, relocation of existing utilities, prepare the proposed final grading/Erosion control, prepare the drainage calculations, inspect the construction work and ensure the installation of site utilities, earthwork, and site improvements.  
 
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Work with multi-discipline engineering project teams to support large and small engineering and EPCm projects
  • Ensure thorough understanding of each project scope, specifications, and design criteria
  • Prepare reports, design criteria, estimates, designs, and drawings
  • Strong design skills in planning, utilities, site layout, grading and roadways including storm water and earthwork calculations
  • Review drawings, providing technical advice on safe designs and construction
  • Obtain planning and/or site/building regulation approvals with varying jurisdictions
  • Work and communicate effectively with other disciplines (architects and engineers)
  • Monitor and inspect all work undertaken by contractors
  • Administer sub-contracts & manage civil projects (schedules, proposals, scopes of work)
  • Inspect geotechnical properties to evaluate the site grading conditions
  • prepare preliminary study base maps (Previous drawings, InfraWorks, ArcGIS Pro etc.)
  • Coordinate and inspect topographic surveys to evaluate existing conditions
  • Use computer aided software for storm water/drainage design and material takeoffs.
YOUR IDEAL BACKGROUND:
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering from an accredited university
  • Experience with engineering services provider, preferred.
  • Experience in AutoCAD Civil 3D, Revu, BIM360, Infraworks, Hydraflow, ArcGIS Pro
  • Advanced knowledge of construction methods, materials, and legal regulations.
  • Well organized, analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills
  • Meticulous attention to detail and ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • Will need to be a good communicator and able to simultaneously manage multiple projects and clients
  • The successful candidate will display an investigative nature and must be accurate, commercially aware and have great communication skills with a keen interest in ensuring the safety and physical integrity of projects.
  • They will have proven budget and schedule management skills with great knowledge of construction processes, materials, and code regulations.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status.
