job.title: Construction Project Manager (34336)
job.description:
Construction Project Manager
Location: Either located in Lexington or Louisville, KY 
Location: Chicago, IL or Downers Grove, IL
Pay Range: $63.00 - $93.00 / hr
Benefits: Standard Medical, Dental & 401(k)

Description

The Construction Project Manager supports the Engineer Procure Construct (EPC) Project Manager or Program Manager to oversee day-to-day operations from pre-construction through project completion and warranty periods. The Construction Project Manager is responsible for managing the construction project safety, quality, schedule, cost control, contracts, subcontractors, suppliers, proposals, estimates, documentation turnover, client relations/management, field staff and other duties required to execute EPC, Construction Management, Construction, and Program Management projects.

 Responsibilities
 
  • Adhere to company’s safety programs, trainings, and policies, as well as promote and manage the Safety and Health performance of project team members and subcontractors.
  • Responsible for the oversight of day-to-day construction activities and the successful execution of single or multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Provide direction and participate in project planning, scheduling, estimating, cost development, and establishing critical project objectives.
  • Develop new and managing existing client relationships while interfacing with the client for proposal and project related items.
  • Participate in internal and external project risk reviews and consult with Legal Department as required.
  • Negotiate prime contracts, CM contracts, subcontracts, and change orders.
  • Participate in risk review process.
  • Implement assigned sections of the Project Execution Plan, including construction execution, construction quality assurance plan, safety & health plan, subcontracting plan, project staffing plan, organization chart, and procurement plan.
  • Develop construction staffing plans and train project teams, coordinate activities of multiple global practices/disciplines, and facilitate the efficient cost-effective utilization of staff while adhering to contractual and performance requirements.
  • Oversee the development of the project plan for site layout, mobilization and demobilization and support implementation.
  • Verify all applicable project permits are secured in accordance with the project requirements.
  • Direct and oversee the downstream request for proposal (RFP) and bid process and prepare detailed scope of work documents for subcontractor and client contractor contracts including bidder development, prequalification, evaluation, award recommendation, and selection.
  • Review, approve, and communicate internal and external reports including project budgeting, project cash flow forecast, and project status reports. Present reports to Project Manager, Program Manager as well as internal and external executive management as required.
  • Collaborate with engineering team to establish the development and distribution of engineering deliverables per project schedule and requirements.
  • Develop processes and manage downstream contract administration including request for information (RFI’s), submittals, change management, contract closeout, documentation, and claims mitigation.
  • Oversee Prime Contract, subcontractor, and client contractor invoicing process.
  • Coordinate and facilitate client, supplier and company commissioning and startup teams as needed.
  • Implement, audit, and oversee project documentation.
  • Implement process for confirming project and subcontractor insurance, taxes/duties, licensures, and bonding requirements.
  • Perform project safety, quality, progress, and financial audits and assessments as required.
  • Oversee and participate in the project-specific non-conformance reporting process.
  • Responsible for facilitating project cost reporting, scheduling, work breakdown structure establishment, project set-up and closeout, and field progress tracking specific to construction and construction-related activities or program level activities as required.
  • Develop and oversee materials receiving and management process, including inventory control, receipt of goods, storage, and transportation as required.
  • Review contract documents with field staff to verify compliance of subcontractors and client contractors, safety and health requirements, quality, and schedule.
  • Direct the project turnover documentation, warranty administration, project closeout, and recordkeeping/retention processes/procedures.
  • Support communication with governmental, industry, and public entities on project-related matters.
  • Review construction field reports.
  • Provide mentorship and training to interns, construction coordinators, craft supervision, and assistant construction project managers.
  • Provide performance feedback for each project team member as requested to their respective Department Managers.
  • Manage community and building trades relationships.
  • Develop and implement project labor agreements with building trades as required.
  • Onboard field/craft supervision as required.
  • Manage composite crew rates to determine labor and equipment costs.
  • Manage staffing on projects.
  • Manage labor burdens including craft classifications, benefits and labor laws.
  • Maintain accurate craft classification and craft progression records.
  • Uphold craft competency and training standards.
  • Estimate, forecast, and manage craft install unit rates.
  • Manage earned value, schedule, change management and cost metrics.
  • Mentor and foster craft training and identify advancement opportunities.
  • Manage construction equipment to ensure adequate inventory to complete projects.
  • May be assigned to a project site based on project requirements.

Requirements
 
  • Bachelor Degree in Construction, Construction Management, Engineering, or a related field AND 7 years relevant project management experience in the construction industry.
  • Applicable experience may be substituted for the degree requirement.
  • Excellent computer skills and proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, and Access).
  • Experience with document control, scheduling, cost control and project management software is preferred.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills and strong organizational skills.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, and attention to detail.
  • Able to hand large volumes of work and multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
  • Multiple years of experience on construction project sites or executing program management in the industries of aviation, commercial, energy, government, manufacturing, oil & gas, process, transportation, transmission & distribution, or water is preferred.
  • A basic understanding of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles is required.
  • Must be able to meet the company’s driving requirements.

 
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any of these characteristics.

job.title: Digital Baseband Design Engineer (34347)
job.description:
Digital Baseband Design Engineer

Location: Dallas, TX
Type: Full-time

About the Role

We are seeking a Digital Baseband Design Engineer to join our wireless systems R&D team. In this role, you will contribute to the design, development, and verification of digital baseband architectures and algorithms that power next-generation wireless infrastructure, including 5G, 6G, and advanced radio platforms. You’ll work at the intersection of digital signal processing, ASIC/FPGA design, and system integration to deliver high-performance, scalable baseband solutions.

Key Responsibilities

  • Define and implement baseband processing architectures for wireless communication systems (5G/6G).

  • Design, model, and verify digital signal processing (DSP) blocks such as channel coding/decoding, MIMO detection, OFDM modulation/demodulation, and beamforming algorithms.

  • Contribute to the design and implementation of ASIC/FPGA baseband IP cores.

  • Perform system-level simulations in MATLAB, C/C++, or SystemVerilog to evaluate performance against standard specifications.

  • Collaborate with system engineers to optimize algorithms for throughput, latency, and power efficiency.

  • Support the integration of baseband modules with RF, antenna, and software components in full system prototypes.

  • Conduct functional verification and debugging of baseband logic using UVM, VHDL, or SystemVerilog.

  • Stay informed on evolving 3GPP standards and contribute to innovative solutions for emerging features.

  • Document design specifications, test plans, and verification results for internal and external stakeholders.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field.

  • 5+ years of experience in baseband design for wireless communication systems.

  • Solid understanding of digital communication theory (modulation, coding, MIMO, OFDM, beamforming).

  • Hands-on experience with ASIC/FPGA design using VHDL, Verilog, or SystemVerilog.

  • Proficiency in simulation and modeling tools such as MATLAB, C/C++, and Python.

  • Familiarity with verification methodologies (UVM, testbench creation, regression testing).

  • Strong problem-solving and debugging skills, with experience in lab validation using oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, and protocol testers.

Nice to Have

  • Experience with 3GPP standards for LTE, 5G NR, or 6G.

  • Knowledge of hardware/software co-design and embedded systems.

  • Experience with DSP processor architectures and parallel computing.

  • Background in high-speed digital interfaces and SoC integration.

  • Exposure to AI/ML-assisted baseband processing techniques.

job.title: Antenna Design Engineer (34345)
job.description:
Antenna Design Engineer

About the Role

We are seeking a highly skilled Antenna Design Engineer to join our cutting-edge wireless systems team. The successful candidate will play a key role in the design, development, and optimization of advanced antenna solutions for 5G, 6G, and next-generation communication networks. This position involves close collaboration with system architects, RF engineers, and product development teams to ensure antenna performance meets stringent requirements for base stations, small cells, and advanced wireless platforms.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design, simulate, and optimize antenna systems for sub-6 GHz and mmWave frequency bands, ensuring compliance with performance, efficiency, and reliability requirements.

  • Conduct electromagnetic simulations using industry-standard tools (e.g., CST, HFSS, ADS) to validate antenna concepts and designs.

  • Support integration of antenna subsystems into radio units, ensuring proper interaction with RF front-end and baseband modules.

  • Develop and test beamforming and MIMO antenna systems for advanced wireless applications.

  • Perform lab measurements, OTA testing, and field trials to validate antenna designs in real-world environments.

  • Collaborate with mechanical engineers to address structural, thermal, and environmental considerations in antenna design.

  • Generate technical documentation, test reports, and contribute to patent filings.

  • Stay current with emerging technologies in 5G/6G, phased arrays, and advanced materials to drive innovation in antenna design.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Communications Engineering, or related field.

  • 5+ years of experience in antenna or RF design, preferably within the telecommunications or semiconductor industry.

  • Strong expertise with EM simulation tools (CST, HFSS, FEKO, ADS, etc.).

  • Solid understanding of RF fundamentals, propagation, impedance matching, and antenna measurement techniques.

  • Hands-on experience with prototyping, testing, and characterizing antennas in lab and field conditions.

  • Familiarity with beamforming, MIMO systems, and advanced wireless communication technologies.

  • Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work across multidisciplinary teams.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Nice to Have

  • Experience with 5G/6G radio access networks, massive MIMO, or mmWave technologies.

  • Knowledge of PCB layout techniques for RF/antenna integration.

  • Experience with anechoic chamber testing, OTA setups, and system-level validation.

  • Familiarity with mechanical design and thermal considerations for antenna systems.

  • Background in semiconductor or wireless infrastructure development.

job.title: Business Development Associate (34354)
job.description:

job.title: Transmission & Distribution Superintendent (34306)
job.description:
Transmission & Distribution (T&D) Superintendent
Location: Charleston, WV (Distribution Side - On-site/Field) & Maryland (Substation Side - On-Site/Field)

The Transmission & Distribution (T&D) Superintendent is responsible for field operations on the assigned project(s) to achieve safe, timely and profitable completion of each project. Plans, organizes, and supervises specific portions of construction work for an assigned area of a construction project.

Responsibilities:

  • Oversight of high voltage transmission lines, transmission line steel and wood structures, drilled piers, spread footings, grounding, environmental requirements, substation equipment, substation structures, substation electrical, and substation controls.

  • Build and maintain strong relationships with clients and subcontractors.

job.title: Process Engineering Professional, Senior (34367)
job.description:
Senior Process Engineering Professional
Location: Greenville, SC (Hybrid)
Benefits: Standard Medical, Dental, and 401(k)
Pay Range:  $70.00 – $100.00/hr.

Responsibilities:
• Serve as subject matter expert (SME) of designs for the oil and gas and alternative fuels/energy industries
• Review conceptual and detailed designs for diverse industries, with emphasis on the oil and gas and alternative fuels/energy industries
• Use best practices and industry knowledge to solve complex engineering problems
• Interface with other engineering disciplines, project management, and clients to provide fully coordinated projects
• Perform quality reviews on designs performed by others
• Mentor junior engineers on basic engineering applications and principals
• Participate in the development of proposals, budgets, and schedules for process-specific work

Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree in chemical engineering
• Minimum 10+ years of experience in engineering design for the oil and gas and alternative fuels/energy industries
• Minimum 20+ years of experience in engineering design as a facilities/plant engineer or as consulting engineer
• Working knowledge of ASPEN Plus, ASPEN Batch, and/or PRO/II a plus
• Experienced user of PipeFlo (Professional and Compressible), AFT Fathom, and HTRI
• Experience with relief devices calculations, including complex cases
• Familiarity with unit operations including but not limited to Gasification, Syngas Processing, Methanol/Ethanol Handling, Distillation, Evaporation, Centrifugation, Drying, Solids Handling and Specialty Gas Handling.
• Experience as a functional lead for a team of multiple individuals
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
• Strong communication skills both verbal and written
• Forward-thinking, eager to learn best practices, and contributing with innovative ideas
• Ability to collaborate and work effectively in a variety of teams, including multi-disciplinary teams
• Willingness to travel
• Professional Engineer license a plus


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any of these characteristics.

job.title: Lab Quality Control Technician (34289)
job.description:
Clover Consulting has a direct client in Grand Rapids, MI in need of a Quality Control Lab Technician for a 6 months contract.  Extensions are likely up to 3 years.  This is an on-site role. 

XS Energy Quality Control Lab Technician
What is special about this role:

As a XS QA lab technician, you will ensure XS Energy Drinks meet the chemical specification requirements by performing Wet Chemistry and Sensory testing. You will have responsibilities related to testing and evaluation, investigation support, laboratory maintenance, environmental monitoring, and other duties. As a part of the high functioning team, you will work in both group and autonomous circumstances while working on-site together. Your ability to work collaboratively will be valued in this role as you work with cross-functional peers in quality and manufacturing to ensure product quality.

Roles & Responsibilities:
• Conduct quality testing on in-process and finished product in the XS plant • Assay and sensory analysis of liquid CO2
• Testing includes use of titrators, density meters, x-rays, and other general laboratory equipment
• Perform taste/odor/appearance evaluation on samples throughout production
• Work both independently as well as with manufacturing
• Communicate with manufacturing when in-process adjustments are required
• Maintain laboratory work area and assist with general laboratory cleaning
• Inventory management Skills to be successful in this role:
• Experience with performing wet chemistry, physical, sensory tests, and can seam testing
• Attention to detail to follow standard operating procedures, safety requirements, test procedures and current good manufacturing practices (cGMP)
• Ability to offer recommendations for continuous improvements
• Talent to prioritize work effectively and complete work efficiently meeting high quality standards
• A desire for a sense of ownership and to be an ambassador of Quality to
Manufacturing

Hours of Operation:
• 1 st shift: 6am-4:30pm Monday-Thursday

job.title: Filter Design Engineer (34346)
job.description:
Filter Design Engineer

Location: Dallas, TX
Type: Full-time

About the Role

We are looking for a skilled Filter Design Engineer to join our RF design and development team. In this role, you will design and optimize RF/microwave filters and multiplexers that are critical to next-generation wireless infrastructure, including 5G, 6G, and advanced radio systems. You will work closely with RF, antenna, and system engineers to ensure high-performance, low-loss, and reliable filter solutions for deployment in cutting-edge telecom networks.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design, model, and simulate RF/microwave filters (LC, cavity, ceramic, SAW, BAW, etc.) to meet system-level performance requirements.

  • Develop high-Q filtering solutions for sub-6 GHz and mmWave frequency bands.

  • Support the integration of filters into transceivers, radio units, and base station platforms.

  • Conduct electromagnetic simulations using tools such as HFSS, CST, ADS, or Microwave Office.

  • Collaborate with antenna and RF teams to minimize interference and optimize coexistence between bands.

  • Perform prototyping, tuning, and characterization of filters in lab and field environments.

  • Analyze filter performance across temperature, power, and environmental stress conditions.

  • Generate technical documentation, test reports, and contribute to patents and publications.

  • Stay updated on advancements in 5G/6G frequency allocations, material technologies, and miniaturization techniques to drive innovation in RF filter design.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, RF/Microwave Engineering, or a related field.

  • 5+ years of experience in RF/microwave filter design within the telecom, semiconductor, or defense industries.

  • Expertise in filter design methodologies (cavity, lumped element, planar, SAW/BAW).

  • Strong skills in EM simulation and circuit design tools (ADS, HFSS, CST, Microwave Office).

  • Hands-on experience in filter prototyping, tuning, and measurement using VNAs and RF test equipment.

  • Understanding of wireless communication standards (LTE, 5G NR, and emerging 6G bands).

  • Strong analytical, troubleshooting, and communication skills.

Nice to Have

  • Experience with high-power filters for base stations and massive MIMO systems.

  • Knowledge of multiplexer and diplexer design for multi-band systems.

  • Familiarity with advanced materials (LTCC, ceramics, acoustic wave technologies).

  • Background in thermal and mechanical design considerations for RF filters.

  • Experience in semiconductor or wireless infrastructure development.

job.title: Senior Quantitative Software Developer (34352)
job.description:
About the Role

We are seeking two highly skilled Quantitative Software Developers to join our team on a contract basis. These consultants will play a critical role in enhancing our stress testing framework, contributing to model validation, development, and optimization initiatives within a leading Canadian financial institution.
This is a hands-on technical role, ideal for senior developers with deep expertise in programming, quantitative finance, and econometrics who can contribute immediately to high-impact projects.

Key Responsibilities
  • Develop and enhance functionalities within the firm’s stress testing framework.
  • Lead and contribute to code optimization efforts to improve efficiency, scalability, and performance.
  • Support the validation and development of financial models, ensuring accuracy and compliance with internal and regulatory standards.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams including model risk, validation, and development teams.
  • Provide subject matter expertise on quantitative methodologies and programming best practices.
Qualifications
  • 10+ years of relevant experience in software development and quantitative finance.
  • Must qualify for Government of Canada Security Clearance (Minimum 5 years of living in Canada)
  • Proven track record working with large financial institutions in Canada (e.g., six D-SIBs or equivalent).
  • Advanced programming skills, with deep expertise in Java and Python (additional languages a plus).
  • Strong background in quantitative finance, econometrics, and model development/validation.
  • Experience contributing to large-scale risk management or stress testing frameworks.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.
Contract Details
  • Term: 6 months (possibility of extension)
  • Location: Remote, Canada-based candidates only
  • Start Date: Targeting early October 2025
If you are an experienced Quantitative Developer with a strong background in financial modeling and programming, we encourage you to apply and help drive critical risk management initiatives.

job.title: Sr. Design Engineer (34365)
job.description:
Job Title: Senior Design Engineer
Location: Wood Dale
Onsite M-F
Rate 90-100k
Bonus 20%

 

About the Company
A design-led manufacturer of retail fixtures serving both domestic and international markets is seeking a Senior Design Engineer. The company is driven by innovation, a passion for client success, and a collaborative culture. With in-house engineering and a responsive operations team, they deliver tailored retail solutions with industry-leading speed and reliability.

About the Role
The Senior Design Engineer will work within a component-driven, modular-based store fixture system to develop cost-effective design solutions for both standard and custom applications. This role collaborates closely with the sales team to create unique solutions tailored to client needs, then adapts designs to align with internal and external manufacturing processes. The engineer will provide detailed CAD data to support production and ensure projects are delivered on time and within budget. In addition, the role involves responsibilities across the engineering function, including design, research, prototyping, documentation, estimating, and process improvement.

Key Responsibilities

  • Produce fixture designs and drawings for internal and customer review

  • Apply efficient, best-practice methods in design/detail work

  • Manage large or complex custom projects to ensure timely completion

  • Source and develop details for efficient production and high-quality results

  • Create assembly and installation drawings for production and client use

  • Collaborate with production/manufacturing to ensure smooth workflow

  • Create and maintain Bills of Materials (BOMs) for all manufactured products

  • Update and revise BOMs as necessary

  • Identify and implement cost-saving opportunities through value engineering

  • Participate in prototype assembly and testing

  • Support ongoing improvements in engineering processes and documentation

  • Perform other duties as assigned by management

Requirements and Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in design, engineering, or related field

  • 8+ years of engineering experience in a wood or metal manufacturing environment (store fixture industry preferred)

  • Strong expertise working with multiple materials (wood, metal, plastics, glass, etc.)

  • Solid understanding of wood/metal manufacturing techniques (cabinetry, laminating, joining methods, hardware, etc.)

  • Familiarity with sheet metal, metal fabrication, aluminum machining, die casting, and extrusion (preferred)

  • Proficiency in 3D solid modeling; Autodesk Inventor preferred

  • Experience with Autodesk software (AutoCAD, Vault, or equivalent)

  • Ability to mentor and train junior engineers

  • Contribute to development of engineering standards and specifications

  • Working knowledge of ERP software

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

  • Strong problem-solving ability and adaptability under tight deadlines

  • Skilled at managing multiple projects while maintaining high-quality standards

job.title: 5G Senior Principle Consultant (34369)
job.description:
RESPONSIBILITIES Works on unusually complex problems and provides highly innovative solutions Uses independent judgment to accomplish goals and objectives Has insight into industry trends and communicates vision to guide organizational strategy and long-range planning Lends research and contributes to evaluations, project plans and budgets for new products or updates existing products Acts as consultant on critical projects that impact long term organizational goals and objectives Leads teams, gives technical guidance and communicates with senior management on progress Identifies or creates solutions that are likely to contribute to the development of new company concepts Expected to set standards and achieve cost targets for product cost through proper design choices, component selection or supplier selection Demonstrated expertise in competitive analysis May actively seek customer input and take responsibility for internal and external customer situations Determines requirements and functional specifications for entire system, under only con.

You will:

Design & Architecture
• Own the RF signal chain for 5G Radio Units (e.g., LNAs, mixers, PLLs/synthesizers, filters, switches, drivers, PAs), with emphasis on low power and high performance.
• Create link budgets and frequency plans; lead trade off analyses to ensure compliance with black box/system requirements under constraints (component availability, thermal, power).
• Drive component selection and vendor technical engagement; guide DFM/DFT and oversee NPI/volume ramp with manufacturing partners.
• Produce clear technical documentation: Design Specs, Verification Plans/Reports, and factory test/calibration requirements.

Implementation
• Perform schematic capture and define layout constraints using Cadence Concept HDL and Allegro.
• Use RF simulation and modeling tools (Keysight ADS, AWR Microwave Office, MATLAB) including EM/Co-sim as needed to de risk designs.

Validation & Test
• Lead bring up and characterization at board, module, and RU level; measure and optimize gain, NF, P1dB, IP3, ACLR, EVM, phase noise, return loss, and related KPIs.
• Develop and execute verification plans; automate tests where practical; collaborate with software for calibration/control to ensure robust HW/SW integration.

Collaboration & Leadership
• Partner with system, digital, software, thermal, and mechanical leads on RU architecture and design integration.
• Mentor junior designers and review their work; contribute to invention disclosures/patents.
• Maintain strong vendor relationships and lead device selection decisions.


Essential Requirements

• Proven record designing RF circuits in the Radio Unit ecosystem and taking hardware to volume production.
• Hands on experience in 4G/5G radio development and RU/subsystem architecture and implementation.
• Strong command of 3GPP specifications and global spectrum/regulatory considerations.
• Advanced understanding of DPD and its implications across the RF chain.
• High proficiency with RF lab equipment (VNA, spectrum/signal analyzers, signal generators, power meters, etc.).
• Proficiency with Cadence Concept HDL/Allegro and RF simulation tools (ADS, AWR, MATLAB).
• Organized, goal oriented technical leader who collaborates effectively across disciplines.

Desirable Requirements

• 7+ years of relevant experience (or equivalent mix of education and experience).
• Experience with PA linearization, calibration (factory/field), and defining factory test strategies with CMs/ODMs.
• Participation in next generation architecture investigations/proposals.

job.title: Quality Assurance Analyst (34370)
job.description:
About the Role
We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Quality Assurance Analyst to join our team on a 6-month contract to cover a maternity leave. This role plays a critical part in ensuring the quality and reliability of our Discounts and Rewards platform, with a strong focus on user experience and Agile development practices. The successful candidate will be responsible for writing and executing test cases, supporting production releases, and collaborating closely with internal stakeholders and external technology vendors.

Key Responsibilities
  • Develop, maintain, and execute comprehensive test cases and test plans.
  • Perform functional, regression, and user acceptance testing in UAT and Production environments.
  • Create and maintain Release Notes for each production release.
  • Identify, document, and track defects using appropriate tools.
  • Collaborate with Project Managers and external development vendors to ensure timely resolution of issues.
  • Provide clear and concise written documentation of test results and QA processes.
  • Assist the Application Support team with incoming tickets from stakeholders when not actively engaged in testing.
  • Contribute to the continuous improvement of QA practices and user experience standards.

Qualifications
  • Minimum 3 years of experience as a Quality Assurance Analyst or in a similar role.
  • Strong understanding of user experience principles and Agile development methodologies.
  • Intermediate proficiency in SQL for querying and validating data.
  • Excellent written communication skills for documentation and stakeholder interaction.
  • Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
  • Experience working with cross-functional teams and external vendors is an asset.

job.title: Senior Electrical Engineer (34379)
job.description:
Senior Electrical Engineer
Location: Remote
Pay Range: $57.88 - $90.44 / hour
Benefits: Standard Medical, Dental, 401(k)



Summary

As an Electrical Engineer in our Advanced Manufacturing group, you’ll contribute to projects that enable the heart of our clients’ successful data center facilities engineering, design and construction. In this role, you will have the chance to work on projects including engineering and design of data centers and other mission-critical facilities.

You’ll provide design work, contribute to team technical collaboration, perform quality reviews of design packages, and assist directly with other portions of the design process. You may also interact directly with the client, owner, and contractors to assist construction on site. You and the other members of your electrical design team will work closely with the broader multi-discipline team in a fast-paced, dynamic, collaborative environment to establish design requirements and produce construction documents.

Responsibilities
 
  • Engineering and design for data center facility power distribution systems, UPS, emergency systems, grounding, lighting, and low voltage communications systems in complex industrial facilities.
  • Design may also include retrofit of existing building systems to accommodate our clients’ continually evolving requirements.
  • Management of quality, scope, budget and schedule.

Your role keeps our company connected and we’ll support you with what you need to be successful. Through mentorship and other career development opportunities, you’ll continue to grow and thrive.

Qualifications & Requirements
 
  • Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering.
  • At least 6 year experience in engineering design of medium and low voltage distribution systems, building electrical systems, and campus-style power distribution including conveyance.
  • Professional Engineer (PE) license.
  • Extensive knowledge of and experience with industrial facility design.
  • Working knowledge of Revit or BIM software.
  • Solid working knowledge of NFPA 70 (NEC).?
  • Effective verbal and written communication skills..

Preferred Qualifications
 
  • At least 3 years of data center facility design experience.
  • Analytical and problem-solving skills.??
  • Forward thinking, eager to learn best practices, and contribute with innovative ideas.?
  • Displayed ability to learn quickly and driven to broaden knowledge base.?
  • Ability to collaborate and work effectively in a variety of teams, including multi-disciplinary teams.?
  • Passionate about buildings and construction.
  • Experience in the design of large projects established on greenfield sites.

job.title: BIM/VDC Coordinator (34377)
job.description:
Virtual Design & Construction (VDC) Coordinator

Location: McCarron, NV
Job Type: Full-Time

About the Role:

We are seeking a Virtual Design & Construction (VDC) Coordinator to join our growing team. This role is perfect for someone who enjoys combining technology and construction, thrives in a collaborative environment, and is excited to work on large, complex projects in both public and private sectors.

As the VDC Coordinator, you will play a key role in bringing projects to life digitally before they're built — from 3D modeling and BIM coordination to supporting field teams with layout and constructability solutions.

What You'll Do:

  • Develop and manage digital layout files (RTS programming, Hilti/Trimble support).

  • Create 3D and 4D models using AutoCAD, Revit, Synchro, Fuzor, etc.

  • Run BIM coordination meetings, track clashes, and resolve issues with subcontractors.

  • Translate 2D drawings into accurate 3D models for field use and QA.

  • Produce 3D logistics plans and animations for preconstruction/site planning.

  • Collaborate with project managers and field staff to solve constructability issues.

  • Maintain BIM standards, templates, and software tools across the company.

  • Provide vendor/software support and represent the company at BIM/VDC seminars.

What We're Looking For:

  • Bachelor's degree in Architecture, Engineering, Construction Management, or related field OR equivalent experience.

  • 4+ years of VDC/BIM experience in commercial construction.

  • Proficiency with Autodesk AEC Collection, Revit, Synchro/Fuzor, SketchUp, Revizto, or Trimble Field Suite.

  • Ability to create and manage 3D/4D models.

  • Strong communicator and collaborator with a self-starter mindset.

  • Part 107 Drone License (or ability to obtain).

Why You'll Love It Here:

  • Be part of a team shaping some of the most high-profile projects in Nevada and the Southwest.

  • Work with the latest VDC and BIM technology.

job.title: Senior Civil Engineer (34356)
job.description:
Senior Civil Engineer
Location: Downers Grove, IL 
Pay Range: $66 - $104.50
Benefits: Standard Medical, Dental, 401(k)

SUMMARY

Our growing practice is looking for strong construction engineering candidates interested in working on some of the most exciting and challenging capital programs in northeastern Illinois.  Each of these programs are unique and present opportunities to step into leadership roles. The projects tend to be small in nature but extremely complex and must be completed in short order to allow for larger sewer rehab projects to be initiated by the City.

Responsibilities

  • Lead civil design of projects from the conceptual phase through design completion for project needs and requirements that are set forth by the project managers.
  • Prepare civil equipment: packaged equipment and construction specifications and data sheets, Request's for Qualifications (RFQ's), technical bid summaries, and purchase recommendations.
  • Review civil vendor drawings; data interface with suppliers, clients other engineering disciplines, detailers, designers.
  • Participate in development of project schedule, scope, budget staffing planning and construction planning.
  • Responsible for effective management of change orders.
  • Applies expert knowledge of commonly used civil concepts, practices, codes and procedures within the civil engineering services industry. Compiles studies and reports. Writes specifications.
  • Applies knowledge and experience to complex projects, find's/develops non-standard design solutions.
  • Quality review production drawings for a variety of projects and project related data as required by the project managers to verify design compliance with project, client, and industry standards, including constructability.
  • Quality review the construction administration including coordination with field personnel to resolve design related installation issues, calculations, field inspections and testing of materials.
  • Leads field inspections, installation, measurements or calculations for public and private clients.
  • Prepare and present technical reports for clients and industry publications.
  • Build effective relationships with existing clients, customers and contractors and develop new business opportunities. Responsible for ensuring customer satisfaction goals and expectations are met.
  • Participate sales and marketing efforts and identify, lead and manage key pursuits.
  • Lead the development of cost proposals and qualification statements to achieve stated targets and standards for financial performance.
  • Prepare, present and manage project budgets and cost estimates. Report project performance.
  • Provide leadership, guidance and instruction to the civil engineering practice. Mentor and guide less experienced engineers.
  • Responsible for QA/QC process adherence.
  • Responsible for effective communication with other engineering disciplines.
  • Responsible for compliance with company and site safety policies.
  • Performs other duties as assigned
  • Complies with all policies and standards
Requirements
  • Bachelor Degree in Civil or related Engineering Technology from an ABET accredited program and successful completion of Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) exam, AND 7 years civil engineering experience  OR Master Degree in Civil Engineering and 6 years civil engineering experience.
  • EPC project experience preferred. 
  • Expert knowledge in standard engineering techniques and procedures.
  • Strong computer skills (e.g. AutoCAD, MicroStation, BIM (Revit), Civil 3D, PLS, PLS-CADD, RISA-3D, MathCADD), and/or hydraulic, hydrologic, pavement, civil analysis programs.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Experience with leading the discipline design for large projects and delegating work tasks to team members.
  • Ability to lead execution of work and resolve issues in a team environment.
  • Demonstrated critical thinking skills, ability to work methodically and analytically in a quantitative problem-solving environment.
  • Strong attention to detail, facilitation, team building, collaboration, organization and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to perform quality reviews for detailed engineering documents and specifications.
  • Ability to travel.
  • Professional Engineer (PE) License Preferred

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any of these characteristics.
